009package imagingbook.common.image.access;
010
011import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
012import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
014import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
015
016/**
017 * Image accessor for scalar images with 32-bit (float) values.
018 */
019public class FloatAccessor extends ScalarAccessor {
020        private final float[] pixels;
021
022        /**
023         * Constructor. See also the factory method
024         * {@link ScalarAccessor#create(ImageProcessor, OutOfBoundsStrategy, InterpolationMethod)}.
025         * 
026         * @param ip  an instance of {@link FloatProcessor}
027         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy to be used (use {@code null} for
028         *            default settings)
029         * @param ipm the interpolation method to be used (use {@code null} for default
030         *            settings)
031         */
032        public FloatAccessor(FloatProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
033                super(ip, obs, ipm);
034                this.pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
035        }
036
037        @Override
038        public float getVal(int u, int v) {
039                int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
040                if (i < 0)
041                        return this.defaultValue;
042                else
043                        return pixels[i];
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
048                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height) {
049                        pixels[width * v + u] = val;
050                }
051        }
052}
